alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Copper River Basin; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 11:03AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...River Rises and Higher Than Normal Water Levels Possible for Cook Inlet and Copper River Basins Through Sunday... Cold temperatures have settled into Cook Inlet and the Copper River Basin. Significant river rises and higher than normal water levels are possible in localized areas on small streams and rivers that are still open. Ice formation associated with the cold temperatures has the the potential to form small ice dams. Ice dams and high water has been observed on Chester Creek and Ship Creek and can be expected on other streams throughout the region that still have sections of open water through Sunday. Monitor your local streams and be prepared for high water associated with these colder temperatures. These conditions will persist until streams have formed a stable ice cover or temperatures warm back to normal. Temperatures are expected to return to normal late this weekend. High water will be very localized and difficult to pin point. Please monitor local conditions especially at known trouble spots. Report elevated water levels or ice jams to the Alaska Pacific River Forecast Center at: nws.ar.aprfc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Copper River Basin; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
